SEARCH
Package com.snakegame.model

Class Snake

java.lang.Object
com.snakegame.model.Snake
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Point>
public class Snake extends Object implements Iterable<Point>
Represents the snake. It handles the snake's movement, growth, direction changes, and collision checks.
Author:
Alessandro Sorbara

    Snake()
    Constructs a new Snake object and initializes its body.

  • Constructor Details

    • Snake

      public Snake()
      Constructs a new Snake object and initializes its body.

  • Method Details

    • initializeSnake

      public void initializeSnake()
      Initializes the snake's body clearing it and then adding three points.

    • getBody

      public List<Point> getBody()
      Returns the body of the snake as a linked list of points.
      Returns:
      the body of the snake

    • head

      public Point head()
      Returns the head of the snake (the first point in the list).
      Returns:
      The head point of the snake.

    • tail

      public Point tail()
      Returns the tail of the snake (the last point in the list).
      Returns:
      The tail segment of the snake.

    • move

      public void move(Direction direction)
      Moves the snake in the specified direction. If the snake is set to grow, it adds a new head segment in the given direction without removing the tail. Otherwise, it removes the tail to maintain the same length.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction in which to move the snake.

    • grow

      public void grow()
      Sets the snake to grow on the next move. This is typically called when the snake eats food, causing its length to increase.

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Point> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the segments of the snake's body. This allows the snake to be used in enhanced for-loops.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Point>
      Returns:
      An iterator over the snake's body segments.
